intro: Keenania modesta, commonly known as the slender keeningia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, which are typically borne on the stems. Keenania modesta is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural study and ecological research.
